intro: Lapeirousia fabricii subsp. fabricii, commonly known as the Cape bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. It produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections around the world.
